page.title: 20WILDLIFE IN BURRA
page.content: SHETLAND HAS MANY DIFFERENT HABITATS FOR ANIMALS.THE SEA IS AN IMPORTANT ONE. WE FIND THE COMMON SEAL AND THE GREY SEAL THE COMMON SEAL IS LESS THAN TWO METRES LONG.GREY SEALS ARE LARGER AND THE BULL MAY BE THREE METRES LONG. AROUND THE COAST OF BURRA LOBSTERS AND CRABS CAN BE FOUND.AS WELL AS A HOST OF DIFFERENT SPECIES OF FISH, MANY DIFFERENT TYPES OF CRABS INCLUDING FIDDLER CRAB ,HERMIT,GREENBACK AND SPIDER CRAB ARE FOUND. THE PORPOISE IS SEEN REGULARLY SWIMMING IN UNISON WITH OTHERS. IT IS APPROX ONE AND A HALF METRES LONG. THEY CAN JUMP TWO METRES OUT OF THE WATER. THEY OFTEN FOLLOW THE BOATS. IN BURRA THERE HAVE BEEN OTTERS SPOTTED, BUT THEY ARE SHY CREATURES AND RARELY SEEN. ON LAND RABBITS, FIELD MICE, RATS AND HEDGEHOGS ARE COMMON,HARES ARE SEEN LESS OFTEN.
